comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: He was an expert from the interstate commerce commission who worked on a civil suit to force the separation of the New Haven railroad from its subsidiary rail, trolley and steamship lines under the Sherman anti-trust act. See The Bemidji daily pioneer., July 24, 1914, Page 8: MOVES AGAINST NEW HAVEN ROAD Charles M. Pratt as director of the New Haven railroad was involved in this case. Charles M. Pratt:

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks for your research, B-59. We'll fill in the name, which incidentally is Frank L. Swacker, the next time we update the record.
